body: Have you set dateFormat on formatter components on your config? http://www.yiiframework.com/doc-2.0/yii-i18n-formatter.html#$timeFormat-detail
No i haven't done any configuration to the i18n component.

Not i18n component, but formatter component.  See here for timezone settings.

http://www.yiiframework.com/doc-2.0/yii-i18n-formatter.html#$defaultTimeZone-detail

As I am still wrestling with dates. I further dug into this issue. I've come to the realization that when

 `//'timezone' => 'America/Tijuana',`

and

`'formatter' => [
            'defaultTimeZone' => 'UTC',
            'timeZone' => 'America/Tijuana',
        ],` 

are both set. The former will matematticaly add to the latter.

In my example the source value is `17:30:16 PM` so formatter generates `19:30:16` which is correct. But if latter `application::$timezone = 'America/Tijuana'` the value will be `2:30:16` (-7 hours from formatter). Or if `application::$timezone = 'Etc/GMT+2'` the value will be `21:30:16`. (+2 hours from formatter).

Hope it helps.

formatter is used to convert dates that are stored in common timezone, normally UTC in the database into user timezone. if you do not want the formatter to change the timezone, `defaultTimeZone` and `timeZone` property must be the same. see also http://www.yiiframework.com/doc-2.0/guide-output-formatting.html#time-zones

Maybe I did not completely understand your comment but if you set the timezone in the formatter explictily, it will ignore application timezone. So I do not really get what you want to say with that.

Here is the test that verifies timezone conversion: https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/master/tests/framework/i18n/FormatterDateTest.php#L656-L666

I'm sorry if I'm not being very clear in my ideas. The issue IS NOT happening with yii\i18n\Formatter but rather IS happening at yii\validators\DateValidator.

If the timezone is set in the formatter explictily, DateValidator IS NOT ignoring application timezone. It's adding it to the formatter's timezone.

DateValidator has a [`timeZone`](http://www.yiiframework.com/doc-2.0/yii-validators-datevalidator.html#$timeZone-detail) property which defaults to the application timezone. it will assume that the input date is in that timezone and will convert it to a unix timestamp (which is always UTC) or convert it to the `timestampAttributeFormat` using the `timestampAttributeTimeZone`.
So in your case it should convert the input time from `America/Tijuana` to UTC. If you do not want any conversion, you have to set the `timestampAttributeTimeZone` to `America/Tijuana`.

I've been analysing this (just the whole day), and agree you're correct, just some thoughts:
In my opinion the "timezone" word usage is a bit ambiguate.

in yii\i18n\Formatter
Formatter::$defaultTimeZone //from (UTC)
Formatter::$timeZone //to (Application)

in yii\validators\DateValidator
DateValidator::$timeZone; //from (User input)
DateValidator::$timestampAttributeTimeZone; //to (UTC)

Same attribute means different direction. And same direction with different attribute.
I understand that both $timeZone attributes matches application::$timezone name tought.

I better understand now how both classes work, BUT I was CLUELESS at first. I think the documentation needs an example (or reference to a wiki) that put this two classes together to work, perhaps leaving a "pending example" mark.
